properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong wind gusts up to 90 km/h will continue this afternoon and evening. Localized, strong wind gusts along the north side of the Cypress Hills are approaching 90 km/h. Winds in this area will continue to be strong until later this evening. The strongest winds will be between the north slopes of the Cypress Hills and Highway 1, southeast of Medicine Hat. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T08:01:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T19:17:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0471834239.2021
Area: Cypress Co. near Tide Lake, Cypress Co. near Suffield and Hwy 879, S.A. 2 near Iddesleigh and Dinosaur Prov. Park, S.A. 2 near Jenner and Atlee, S.A. 2 near Buffalo and Cavendish, S.A. 2 near Bindloss Empress and Social Plains, Co. of Newell near Patricia, Co. of Newell near Tilley and Rolling Hills, Cypress Co. near CFB Suffield, Cypress Co. near Bowell and Redcliff, Cypress Co. near Seven Persons, Cypress Co. near Dunmore and Woolchester, Cypress Co. near Irvine and Walsh, Cypress Co. near Bowmanton Schuler and Hilda, Cypress Co. near McNeill and Sandy Point District Park, City of Medicine Hat, Co. of Forty Mile near Bow Island and Whitla, Co. of Forty Mile near Foremost, Co. of Forty Mile near Etzikom and Maleb, Co. of Forty Mile near Orion and Manyberries, Cypress Co. near Cypress Hills Prov. properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with visibility occasionally near zero in blowing snow continue this morning in Naujaat. Tucked between high pressure over western Nunavut and low pressure to the east, northerly winds gusting up to 70 km/h are creating near zero visibilities in blowing snow. These conditions are expected to improve by Monday morning. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T00:22:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T08:23:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4125076411.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An Arctic air mass combined with strong northwesterly winds will give wind chill values near -38 from Sunday evening to Monday morning. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T07:32:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T15:33:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2576643374.2021
Area: Chibougamau, Gouin Reservoir area, Parent area, Ashuapmushuan Wildlife Reserve area, Normandin - Péribonka area, Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area, Lake Bouchette area, La Tuque area, Manic-5 area, Manic-3 area, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area, Falardeau - Mont-Valin area, Sainte-Rose-du-Nord area, Ville de Saguenay area, Rivière-Éternité - Petit-Saguenay area, Tadoussac - Baie-Sainte-Catherine area, Apica Mountain area, Grands-Jardins Park area, l'Étape area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-15T03:12:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-14T11:13:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3451035328.2021
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A developing low pressure system over central Alberta is causing strong to severe southerly wind gusts over southwestern Saskatchewan this afternoon. Wind prone areas in the vicinity of the Cypress Hills will see sustained winds of 70 km/h with gusts as high as 90 km/h this afternoon into early evening before tapering off later this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T05:04:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T19:12:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2494763323.2021

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Strong winds gusting as high as 80 km/h, combined with 5 cm of snow, will produce blizzard conditions starting this evening. The blizzard conditions will improve Monday morning as the winds begin to ease. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T06:11:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T14:12:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1865252667.2021
Area: Kugluktuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of heavy snow are expected this afternoon. Visibilities in snow squalls may be greatly reduced due to intense snow and blowing snow. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for brief but intense bursts of heavy snow producing near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T01:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T15:33:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1563056356.2021
Area: Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area, Weedon area, Thetford Mines area, Mont-Orford - Lake Memphrémagog area, Sherbrooke area, Coaticook area, Lac-Mégantic area, Cookshire area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of heavy snowfall will continue today in areas around Great Slave Lake. Snow will continue today and tonight bringing total amounts of 15 to 25 cm. Heavy snowfall will taper off by Monday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T08:36:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T16:37:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0439469293.2021
Area: Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, Yellowknife Region, North Slave Region including Wekweeti - Whati - Behchoko, Lutsel K'e Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. An intensifying low pressure system over northern Baffin Bay continues to track southwards towards Davis Strait. As the low approaches Clyde River, increasing northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h will cause deteriorating conditions at times in blowing snow. Blizzard conditions may develop at the community this evening and persist through the day Monday before improving Monday night as winds diminish. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T11:28:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-14T19:29:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1653245875.2021
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR QUESNEL The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Northern Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Quesnel because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
